Aida desea seguir avanzando y fortalecer aún más su negocio y en un futuro poder montarlo en el centro de la ciudad, donde pueda incrementar su clientela y generar mayor rentabilidad para dar a su familia un mejor bienestar y condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Aida, 46 years old, has two children and lives with her life partner. She has been making clothes as a subcontractor for about 30 years. She has a workshop in her home and works from Monday to Saturday. She uses her earnings to contribute to the household. She learned her trade from her mother, who is sadly deceased. Aida is a positive, optimistic, hardworking woman who is devoted to her family and to her work. She is requesting this loan to buy two industrial sewing machines so she can increase her production. By making her process more efficient and completing orders more quickly, she will be able to take on new contracts and increase her income. Aida hopes to keep moving forward and expanding her business. In the future she'd like to open a business downtown, where she could increase her customer base and become more profitable, offering her family better living conditions and increased well-being.

loans.use: to buy two industrial sewing machines.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en:
Saturnino is 49 years old. He is a farmer who lives in Alcala. He has four children, and only one is living with him. The others live separately. Aside from planting and harvesing rice to sell, Saturnino also provides motorcycle transport services as an additional source of income when he is not busy in farming. He has a strong determination to succeed. 

He is now asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his farming maintenance. This will help him improve his crop yield. Someday, Saturnino hopes to become a succesful farmer to keep earning good funds for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his farm maintenance.

loans.name: Samson Mburu

texts.en:
Samson is 62 years old and married to Margaret. They are supporting two children, aged 8 and 6 years old.

He has a general shop in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has been running for three years. He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy maize flour, rice and sugar, among other items. With the anticipated profit, he plans to buy more stock for his business and also boost his farming business.

In the near future, he hopes to expand his general shop and farming businesses.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, rice, and sugar, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Ayoub

texts.en:
Ayoub is a 34-year-old, married man and father of three children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a distributor of foods, using his rickshaw to transport his goods. He works hard to meet the family's expenses. He would like to stock goods to increase his profit. 

For this reason, he has applied for a loan of 80,000 YER (Yemen rials) to buy foods in order to distribute them by using his rickshaw. He is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for him and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy foods in order to distribute them by using his rickshaw.

loans.name: Luis Ángel

texts.es: Luis es un hombre de 59 años de edad que ha vivido en el campo desde que nació, allí conoció las tareas agropecuarias, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. Hoy en día se dedica a comercializar ganado bovino de levante, compra los terneros, los cría  y alimenta y luego los vende, de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar y suplir las necesidades básicas de su familia que la conforman su esposa y tres hijos. Es pujante y trabajador, características con las que se reconoce a los habitantes del campo, con esmero y dedicación ha logrado conseguir lo que se propone. Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el que desea comprar más terneras de levante, así podrá aumentar su producción y tendrá la posibilidad de mejorar el margen de utilidades que recibe por la venta de los animales, también le ayudará a ampliar su hato y darle un uso adecuado al terreno que posee, donde desarrolla su labor. Luis espera que se mejoren las dificultades que enfrenta el sector lechero, pues sueña con complementar su labor con la producción lechera, abriéndose la posibilidad de incrementar su capital de trabajo y mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas que ama.
texts.en: Luis is 59 years old and he has lived in the countryside since he was born. That’s where he learned agricultural work, thanks to his parents’ teaching. Now he sells young cattle. He raises them and feeds them and then sells them. This is how he generates sufficient income to take care of his household and provide for his family’s basic needs. His family is his wife and their three children. He is thriving and a hard worker, characteristics that are well-known among people who live in the countryside. With painstaking care and dedication he has achieved his goals. He is requesting a loan because he wants to buy more young cattle. This way he could increase his production and have the possibility of improving the income margin he receives from the sale of his cattle. It would also help him to expand is herd and get full use out of the land he owns, which is where he works. Luis hopes that the difficulties faced by the milk industry will improve because his dream is to complement his work with the production of milk. This would open the possibility of increasing his working capital and improving his loved ones' quality of life.

loans.use: to buy young cattle

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which lies in the tea growing region of Kenya. He has three children and has been doing this work for seven years. His primary income sources are milk, tea and crops.

He says rabbit keeping is the most enjoyable thing about farming. His biggest challenge is market prices. One animal on the farm has been given the name of Tuiyei.

Wesley was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "Because of [the] low interest rate and easy mode of repayment.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He responded, "Loans should be paid on time to reduce cost."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?," Wesley replied that his "family income will increase."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Wesley owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, solar power and TV, but does not have electricity, running water, sewing machine, or DVD.

loans.use: To purchase rabbits.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
This is Analyn. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy the materials and products needed in her farm. It also helped in the education of her children. She has the farm for eight years now. Her income from this business is very useful in their everyday expenses at home. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Analyn dreams that her farm will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and garden inputs needed in her business.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Managing her general store business is Amalia's type of income-generating activity for her family. She is 56-years-old and is a widow. Amalia has two children; one is married while the eldest is still attending school. Amalia’s husband died 12 years ago; that’s why she carries each parents duties and responsibilities solely. Just to sustain her children's necessities, Amalia is also driving their motorcycle for a transport business for additional earnings. Amalia wishes to expand her general store business because she can not manage driving their motorcycle all the time and she is getting older too. With this, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy shampoo, conditioner, soap, canned goods, toothpaste, and more. Amalia wishes for the continuous operation of her store while she can still manage it well.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioner, soap, canned goods, toothpaste and more for her general store.

loans.name: Genalen

texts.en:
This is Genalen. She previously accessed an PHP 20,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another PHP 20,000 loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Genalen dreams to have an extension for her store and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* - All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her general store business.

loans.name: Algin

texts.en:
Algin is a 29 year old married woman  from the town of  Talibon, Bohol. She has 2 young children aged 3 and 5. Her husband is a fisherman.

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells various items like eggs, canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, soap and seasonings. Her business started 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy more soft drinks, rice and various grocery products for her shop, to attract more customers and improve the variety they have to choose from. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her sari-sari store to fund her children’s education and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, rice and various grocery  products to sell in her shop

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 26-year-old single man, and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a very hardworking soldier who gets a low salary. In addition to his career, he has a small grocery store that used to cover his family's expenses (brothers and parents). He is a responsible and determined man who is always seeking alternative opportunities to help provide a better life for his family. Mohammed's house is located in a rural area and he needs to make some improvements to it. He plans to install doors and windows and finish building a bedroom. He is very excited about these modifications because he knows that it will make his family safer and more comfortable. However, he doesn't presently have enough capital to purchase everything he needs to carry out the home improvements. For this reason, he decided to request a loan of YER 300,000 to purchase doors and windows to complete building his house. He hopes with this loan the family can live in a more comfortable place.

loans.use: to purchase doors and windows to complete building his house.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 57 years old and married with four children.

Teresa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more soft-drinks, curls, bread, soap and other groceries.

Teresa has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Teresa aspires to save money to expand her business and improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft-drinks, curls, bread, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en: Elvin is a 28 year old married man with two children and resides in Tonggo, tudela, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, he operates a services based business providing motor transportation to the community. He carries passengers and baggage to the respective destinations of his customers.  After many years of service, he needs to repair his motorcycle to render better services. He is requesting 7,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC micro credit. He is hopeful to make his business successful and generate more profit for his family's needs.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 60 years old and widowed with five children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Myrna has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 40 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Myrna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rolan

texts.en: Rolan is a single farmer of Mitugas, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He has been working on his own farm for three years now to make a living. He wants to prove to himself that he can earn money from his own effort. He borrowed a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC micro credit to finance the weeding maintenance costs of the farm. He hopes to have a good harvest in return from his investments to use the profit for his better living in the future.

loans.use: to finance the weeding maintenance costs of the farm.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 43 years old from Nyahururu. She is married to John, who is a farmer and they have four children aged 23, 21 and twins aged 19.

She is a businesswoman who sells clothes. She has been operating the business for the last three years to enable her add to more stock of clothing, i.e five bales of secondhand clothes. Hellen has applied for her third loan of KES 50,000 from Kadet Ltd after successfully repaying the previous one.

Hellen's income per month is KES 20,000. She has plans of using the anticipated profits from her expanded business for building a permanent house on a plot she owns.

Her hopes and dreams for her business and family is that in the future, she will purchase land and expand the current business in order to be financially independent.

loans.use: to add more stock of clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kihani Turise Group

texts.en:
Kihani Turise Group is mainly comprised of women and a few men. The group is located in a Trading Center about 10 kilometers away from Ibanda town; its members deal in small scale trade and agriculture.

Fausta is a single mother, who divorced her husband because he married a second wife in 2009. She lives with her five children and one dependent- a daughter of one of her relatives. Fausta runs a small retail shop with capital of 100,000 UGX, which is boosted by the income she gets from her piggery farm that she also operates when she is not at the shop.

Fausta has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX to help her construct a concrete floor shelter for her pigs, which are being affected by the rainy season. She will use the rest of the money to pay the tuition fees for her children. Her customers are neighbors and passersby.

Her major challenge is harsh climatic conditions, which affect her pigs due to poor housing. Moreover, her children also fall sick, which affects labor on her piggery project and shop.

Despite the above challenges, Fausta is a very hard working mother who strives hard to provide a good education and an improved standard of living to her children. The group comprises of 14 members, who all signed the waiver form, but two of them are still saving and will acquire the loan next cycle.

loans.use: To buy cement and hire labor to construct a pigsty for her piggery business.

loans.name: Kalep

texts.en:
Kalep is the first ever college graduate from his hometown, a small off-grid village (pop; approximately 700) on Alor island in the eastern part of Indonesia. He moved to Kupang city in West Timor, the capital of East Nusa Tenggara province to further his career. 

He worked with an NGO for over a decade, then decided on a career change.  He started a small business that sells a variety of products from flight tickets to phone and electricity credit. To assist his village back in Alor, he set up a savings and loan group to serve the unbanked community with basic financial services. 

After learning about Kopernik’s simple and life-changing technologies such as solar lights, water filters, and clean cookstoves, his entrepreneurial spirit was sparked again and he sees the promising opportunity of joining Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network. He not only sells the technologies but introduces solutions to his customers’ problems: difficult access to clean water, unaffordable LPG gas which make them to choose between three stone fire or kerosene stove, and frequent power cuts. 

With a high demand for simple, eco-friendly technologies, Kalep is going to use the loan to buy more stock of green technology products and reach more people. Kalep is positive, responsible and offers good quality customer service.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks for his technology kiosk

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 30-year-old shopkeeper; he is single. Samuel has been running his retail shop for the past five years with a monthly income of 4,000 KES that he uses to meet his needs and those of the business. 

Samuel is applying for his second loan term with KADET. He will use the loan to buy stock for his business such as sugar, flour, cosmetics, oil, etc. With the anticipated profit from his business, he will repay his loan and expand his business. Samuel hopes and dreams that he will have a sustainable business and a happy family.

loans.use: To buy stock for his retail business such as sugar, flour, cosmetics, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: construct a zero grazing unit for his agriculture business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 50-year-old married man with six children. Patrick is hard working man, self motivated, and innovative. Patrick comes from Engari in the Kiruhura district. He has a disability, but that hasn’t stopped him from doing his businesses and prospering. Patrick does cattle fattening and farming as his businesses and he has managed to pay the tuition fees for his children. He also gets money from milk sales.

Patrick sells his cattle to the fellow farmers and butchers.However, he has challenges of inadequate land where he can to graze his cattle as well as seasonal changes and price fluctuations.

He wants UGX 2,500,000 to buy cross breed cows that will give him more yields in terms of milk and his income will improve, which will change his status. He has a dream to expand on his farm size.

loans.use: To buy cross breed cows for his cattle business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 31-years-old and she lives in Kongowea area where she runs a small retail business that sells assortment of small products like soap, detergents and ground nuts. The business is the sole income earner for her and the family. She is a married wife and mother of three children. All her three children attend school. She started her business three years ago and the business has been doing fine. She learned of Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy a fridge. She hopes that in five years time she will be able to grow the business into a wholesale one. The extra income that she will raise will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for her retail business.

loans.name: Agape Group

texts.en:
A mother of 12 children, Mashakarugo is 45 years old. Her husband is jobless. She is a member of Agape business group; she sells potatoes. She started this activity seven years ago. 

The new loan will allow her to buy two sacks of potatoes. Her hope is to sustain her activity in order to continue paying school fees for her children and to feed them. The client is thankful to Hekima for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of potatoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Shammar Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of cousins from three families living in the same village.  They range in age from 18 to 26 years old.  The group members are not employed and have been relying on seasonal casual labour as a source of income.  They came together to start this group so that they could make more money from their farming activities.  They are undertaking horticulture as their income-generating project, which is located on one of the member’s homesteads.  From the proceeds of their project, they will raise income for their families. 

They intend to use this loan to purchase a drip kit, seedlings and fertilizers as well to construct a mushroom growing house.  From the proceeds of the first crop under drip irrigation, they intend to purchase mushroom spores and increase the area of their cropping under drip irrigation.  The group plans to increase the area under drip irrigation from 250 to 750 square meters, by purchasing more drip kits over the next two cropping cycles (six to eight months from now).  With the introduction of mushroom production into their business, they aim to supply the local market as well as food outlets.  They also would like to use the proceeds from their business to build their own houses so that when they start their own families they are staying on the same homesteads with their parents or relatives. 

Simelukuthula (the group leader) is a young woman aged 26 and has twin children, a girl and a boy, aged two.  She currently stays on her own as her husband migrated to South Africa in search for employment.  However, since he migrated a year ago, he has struggled to find permanent employment and has therefore been unable to send any money to support the children he left behind.  Simelukuthula has thus been engaged in trading a variety of trinkets from which she raises money to take care of her children.  With proceeds from this loan, it is her hope that her income will increase and she will save to purchase household assets and build her own house. 

PENYA assists borrowers with entrepreneurial skills training through the Start and Improve Your Business (SIYB) Program.  PENYA also helps them form Village Savings and Loans Associations where they save proceeds from their businesses that will then become the future sources of additional loans and business investments.  Finally, PENYA carries out mentoring and monitoring visits to ensure that the businesses are being run viably.  Through linkages created with extension workers and some buyers, PENYA borrowers have access to further training in the production and selling of their produce.

loans.use: to purchase a drip kit, seedlings and fertilizers as well to construct a mushroom growing house.

loans.name: Keelian

texts.en:
Keelian lives in Kongowea area near Mombasa, Kenya. He is 33 years of age and he is a businessman. He is also a husband and a father of two. 

For the last two years he has been selling plastic bags near the market. Most of his customers are the buyers who come to the market and buy in small quantities. He also owns a sewing machine. He learnt about Milango from friends and now he is seeking a loan to buy more plastic bags for his business. 

He hopes that the business will grow big enough to enable him buy a motorbike for the business. Currently he has to walk on foot to sell his products. The extra income that he will generate will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more plastic bags.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income.

Leonarda is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing net, lead weights, hooks and other items. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Leonarda hopes to improve their fishing business and make it a stable source of income for them.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net, lead weights, hooks and other items.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is a 26-year-old man. He lives in Batumi with his mother, step-father and sister. The main source of income for the family is from a car wash business. Mamuka runs the car wash and earns 400 GEL per month. 

He decided to expand his business and add a carpet cleaning service to it. He needs to purchase equipment and he requested a loan for this. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, gives him a chance to purchase the needed equipment for $ 900.

loans.use: to expand his car wash business and add a carpet cleaning service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is a 52-year-old married woman. She lives in Rustavi with her daughter and husband, George. Her daughter goes to school. George has a car and works as a driver. Lali runs a trading business. 

She used to go to Turkey to purchase household goods and linens to sell in Georgia. She has been involved in this business for two years. Lali discovered that going to Dubai is more profitable than going to Turkey, because she can purchase things there cheaper and there is a wider selection. 

The Start-Up program enables her to get a loan of $ 2,000 to purchase more stock. Lali already has orders from her clients.

loans.use: to purchase household goods and linens.

loans.name: Manelin

texts.en:
Manelin is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Manelin has been in the business for more than four years now. This is the source of her income. 

Manelin is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, shampoo and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater for more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. 

In the future, Manelin hopes to make her business a success and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, shampoo and toiletries.

loans.name: Mary Irene

texts.en:
This is Mary Irene. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy medical supplies, which she will resell to customers. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also sells school supplies and in catering business for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy medical supplies, which she will resell to customers. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Irene dreams to have a branch soon and hopes to have her own family in five years. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the group members and the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for medical supplies, which she will resell to customers.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Talibon, Bohol. She makes a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Christine has been in the business for more than three years now.

Christine is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

Through this loan, she will be able to improve her stock and attract more buyers thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Christine hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Crisologa

texts.en:
Crisologa is a 62-year old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with four children. The oldest is 14 while the youngest is six. Her husband is a fisherman.

She engages in fishing. She sells fish, crabs and sea shells to earn a living. Together with her husband, they work together to support their daily needs. Her business started more than 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy a fishing net, a crab net and nylon to help augment their income, and help improve her daily catch.

In the future, she hopes to expand her fishing business and increase business profitability for the sake of her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, a crab net and nylon.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy lives in Kaloleni area near Mariakani. She is 23 years of age and she is married with one child. She sells motorcycle spare parts in Kaloleni and she started the business from her own personal savings that she had. She hopes that the business will grow so it has many branches in other areas despite the usual challenges of price changes and high transportation and fuel costs. 

She learned of Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy engine oil and spare parts for sale in the shop. The extra income will be ploughed back into the business so that she can advertise her business.

loans.use: to buy engine oil and spare parts.

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is a 56-year-old man. He lives in a small village of Bolnisi district. He has worked on outdoor stone decoration for 15 years. Guram also gets orders to renovate bathrooms. His income varies from 300 to 500 GEL per month. 

Guram decided to diversify his business and raise pigs. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and MFO Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,000 GEL to purchase piglets. Guram will raise and sell them.

loans.use: to raise pigs.

loans.name: Korto

texts.en:
Korto is 35 years old and lives in Logan Town. She is married to a driver and has three children aged between 7 and 16. They are attending school and living at home. She is an 11th grade dropout.   

She has been operating a shop for the past five years now where she sells charcoal by the bag. She explains that having only a small amount of capital is her challenge. She sells seven day a week and works ten hours per day.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal by the bag for her business. She plans to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia had a first loan that she repaid without challenges. She was able to grow her business. She is now seeking another loan to to add retail stock; e.g. rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc to her shop. 

There have been challenges that she had to deal with like price changes which make it difficult to sell and the fact that some of her customers did not pay on time. The extra income that she will raise from as a result of the loan will improve her standard of living and she will also be able to save for the future.

loans.use: To add retail stock such as rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Vata

texts.en:
Vata lives in Kongowea area north of Mombasa, Kenya. She is 42 years old and is a single mother of one child. She sells second-hand clothes and this is the business she has done for the last two years. She wants her business to grow into a wholesale business at some point. The major challenges she has been facing in the business are high fuel and transportation costs and the competition which is very stiff for her. 

She learned of Milango through friends and she decided to join so that she could access funding for her business. She now seeks a loan to buy five bales of second-hand clothes for sale. The extra income that she will raise will improve her standards of living and also allow her to expand her business operations.

loans.use: to buy five bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 42 years old, a married woman and a mother of three. She is striving hard to meet their demands including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business of sewing clothes to contribute to the family's income. She is very familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

Now she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of needles and buttons. This will mean she can meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of needles and buttons.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 58-year-old woman and a mother of three. She has been running a business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

Shamim requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through bigger sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Yeimi De Los Angeles

texts.es: Yeimi tiene la edad de 30 años, es una mujer que se dedica al negocio de la venta de cosméticos y ropa  además tiene una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio  desde hace 3 años, casada, con dos hijos adolescentes  de 14 y 11 años. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de inventario de ropa como pantalones, blusas, camisas, faldas, perfumes, maquillajes, etc.
texts.en: Yeimi is 30 years old. She is a woman who works in the business of selling cosmetics and clothes. She also has had a general store in her home for 3 years. She is married and has two teenage children, aged 14 and 11. She is asking for the loan to buy clothing inventory such as pants, blouses, shirts, skirts, perfume, makeup, etc.

loans.use: to invest in buying pants, blouses, shirts, skirts, perfumes, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es: Aristides, a sus 26 años de edad se dedica a trabajar en un negocio que inició hace 3 años en sociedad con su esposa (ver foto), una legumbrería que se encuentra ubicada en una esquina muy transitada del barrio donde vive, allí trabaja todos los días y ha obtenido muy buenos resultados, pues la aceptación en la zona ha sido muy positiva. La idea surgió de la necesidad de cumplir el sueño de comprar casa propia, por ello ha luchado con esfuerzo y mucha dedicación. Este negocio se ha convertido en la columna vertebral de los sueños de esta pareja, por lo que se motiva y busca opciones que le permitan crecer y seguir avanzando. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertir en unas adecuaciones locativas que ya comenzaron y para comprar surtido al pro mayor (frutas y verduras), de esta manera podrá dar una mejor imagen al negocio, que permita atraer más clientes y ofrecer mayor variedad de alimentos, satisfaciendo las necesidades y gustos de sus compradores. Aristides, además de cumplir el sueño de tener casa propia, desea también expandir su negocio hacia otros barrios, ampliando su mercado y directamente sus finanzas familiares, pero es consciente que para lograrlo debe continuar trabajando con esfuerzo, disciplina y organización, pues esta será la clave para alcanzar el éxito y poder disfrutar al lado de su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Aristides is 26 years old and works at a business that he started 3 years ago in partnership with his wife (see photo). It is a vegetable stand located in a very busy corner in the neighborhood where they live. He works there every day and has obtained good results and it has had a positive acceptance in the area. The idea came about out of needing to make his dream come true of buying his own house. He has fought for that with hard work and a lot of dedication. This business has become the backbone of this couple's dreams. That is why he is motivated and seeking opportunities that will allow it to grow and keep going ahead. He is asking for the support of the loan to invest more in some improvements on the locale that have already been started and to buy stock wholesale (fruit and vegetables). This way, he can give his business a better image that will allow for attracting more customers and a larger variety of food, filling the needs and tastes of his buyers. Aristides, in addition to making his dream come true of having his own house, also wants to expand his business into other neighborhoods, widening his market and his family finances directly. He is aware that to achieve this he must continue working hard with discipline and organization. This is the key to achieving success and being able to enjoy a better quality of life being at his family's side.

loans.use: to invest in improvements on the locale that have already been started and to buy stock wholesale (fruit and vegetables).

loans.name: Rasul

texts.ru: Расул житель Истаравшана. Ему 24 года. Он не женат и не имеет детей. Расул живет с дедушкой, с родителями, братьями и сестрами. Расул предоставляет свои услуги по перевозке товаров и вещей на своей грузовой машине КАМАЗ. Цель займа Расула является покупка легковой машины, чтобы заняться услугой такси. У Расула трехлетний водительский стаж. Он хочет быть таксистом потому что в городе Истаравшана очень мало таксистов и транспортных средств. У Расула есть все возможности заняться своим любимым делом, только нет возможности купить машину. Он надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Rasul is a resident of Istaravshan. He is 24 years old. He is not married and does not have children. Rasul lives with his grandfather, parents, brothers and sisters. Rasul is providing a service transporting goods and merchandise on his track by make of Kamaz. Rasul's reason for the loan is to buy a car to start providing a taxi service. He has three years experience driving. He wants to become a taxi driver because there are not many taxi drivers and transportation means in Istaravshan. Rasul has all of the abilities to start doing what he loves, but just cannot buy a car. He hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Julio Aurelio

texts.es: Julio, a sus 46 años de edad es padre de 4 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Durante su vida productiva trabajó en una empresa, pero hace 14 años se retiró y comenzó a laborar en construcción como independiente, luego vendió frutas y verduras en una carreta, de manera ambulante y se le presentó la oportunidad de adquirir un local en la plaza de mercado de la ciudad. Hoy en día posee una tienda de abarrotes en el centro, trabaja de Lunes a Domingo y genera un empleo directo. Él ve como ventajas el poder manejar su propio tiempo y con los buenos resultados que ha tenido pudo comprar su casa propia, pero la principal desventaja por la que se ve afectado es no tener prestaciones sociales, sin embargo, esto no lo desanima y siempre busca opciones que le permitan seguir adelante. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en surtido al por mayor (panela, granos, pastas, galletería, productos cárnicos, entre otros) así podrá abastacerse con referencias que le solicitan y no las tiene, ampliando la variedad de su portafolio de productos para satisfacer las necesidades de los compradores; de esta forma el margen de utilidades incrementará notablemente, pues podrá vender más productos. Julio sueña con tener la posibilidad de dar educación universitaria a sus hijos, pues ya 2 de ellos están a punto de ser profesionales en odontología, y desea que los dos hijos menores puedan contar con esta misma oportunidad de crecer a nivel personal y laboral, pues Julio ve en ello la posibilidad de prosperar en familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida de todos.
texts.en: Julio, is 46 years old. He is the father of 4 children and lives in a common law marriage with his spouse. During his productive life he has worked at a business, but 14 years ago he left and started working in construction independently. Later he sold fruit from a cart as a street vendor and he had the opportunity to acquire a locale in the market plaza in the city. Today he has a general store in the center of town. He works Monday through Sunday and generates one direct job. He sees the advantages, such as being able to manage his own time, and with the good results that he has had, he has been able to buy his own house. The main disadvantage that affects him is not having social benefits. Nonetheless, this doesn't discourage him and he always looks for ways that will allow him to get ahead. He is asking for the loan to invest in wholesale merchandise (brown sugar, grains, pasta, cookies, meat products, and more). This way, he can stock up on what people ask him for that he doesn't have and widen the variety of products to satisfy the needs of his buyers. This way, the profit margin will notable increase and he will be able to sell more products. Julio dreams of having the possibility of giving his children a college education. Two of them are about to become professionals in dentistry and he wants the younger children to have the same opportunity to grow on a personal and professional level. Julio sees in this the possibility of prospering in his family and improving everyone's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (brown sugar, grains, pasta, cookies, meat products and more).

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 38-year-old married woman. She has successfully built her business which is a general store, with the support of Kashf foundation and Kiva loans. She has nine years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 55,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is a 33-year-old man. He lives in Marneuli district with his wife and two sons. His sons go to school. His wife gets orders to bake cakes and sells them from home. Artur has a taxi business. 

He decided to start an additional business. He will purchase clothes to sell. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo gives him a chance to get a loan of $ 3,000 to purchase stock. After the stock is purchased, he will transport it by car and sell it.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kyabagyerwa Church Group

texts.en:
Kyabagyerwa Church group is an old group in UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) and has been trusted for three cycles. Allen, a member of the group and a mother of seven started with the group as a group treasurer and she is still with the group. They are twelve members and the majority of them are involved in agriculture. Allen herself is involved in the coffee trade and she has secured ugx.1,000,000 for herself to by buy more goats to sell in order to supplement her coffee business.She takes the goats to weekly markets where she sells to both farmers and to those taking for slaughter. 
The whole group secured a loan of ugx.7,860,000 to run their different businesses and they have future plans of securing up to ugx.100,000,000 such that they can start a village empowerment group organization. The group is well organized and they appreciate Kiva's efforts to fund them through UGAFODE.

loans.use: To buy goats for sell

loans.name: Ymer

texts.en:
Ymer lives in the rural south central area and his village is built very high in the mountains. Some months back, he got the license to chop and sell timber. Prior to this, he was working in the mining industry until it closed down. 

Kindly note that the reason that Ymer hasn’t been photographed in his business location is that he is at the very beginning, thus there is not much to show. 

The loan that Ymer is requesting from Kiva lenders will be used to build a fence around the field where he plans to gather, organize and sell the timber. This will be his first loan and knowing his nature, he says that he will pay this loan on time.

loans.use: to build a fence around the field where he plans to gather, organize and sell the timber.

loans.name: Ghulam  Fatima

texts.en: Ghulam Fatima is a 34-year-old married woman who has run a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two buffaloes, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit.  Ghulam Fatima has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Sarwari

texts.en: Sarwari is a 28-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the picture) at the corner of her house. She has 4 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of 4 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old, married with three children and she is supporting one child.

She has a business selling clothes in Ndunyu Njeru which she has had for the past twenty-five years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to buy clothes to re-sell. With the anticipated profit, she plans to buy more stock for her business.

She hopes to apply for a bigger loan from Kadet Ltd. to boost her business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Thabu

texts.en:
Thabu is happy to have recieved a Kiva loan that she repaid without many challenges. She was able to buy some retail stock from the previous loan and her income also improved. 

She now seeks another loan to buy retail stock, e.g., rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil and cereals for the business. She wants to have a very stable business in the next five years and lead a very stable life. 

The challenges that she faces in the business are price changes and inflation. The extra income that she will raise will improve her living standards.

loans.use: To add stock such as rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil and cereals.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is 35 years old, a married woman and a mother of four children. She began stitching work in her house five years ago after her husband’s business failure. She stitches clothes for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces and zippers. This will allow her to increse her revenues, and she will be able to generate a healthier source of income to meet her family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 33 years old and a vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will allow her to create a means of increasing revenues so she can generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for the past five years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; now she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin is a 26-year-old married man. He lives in a small village of Marneuli district with his wife, mother and pensioner grandmother. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 0.3 hectares of land and grow potatoes, tomatoes and maize. They sell the harvested products. In addition, Elvin works on renovation with a group of people and shares the profit with them. 

Elvin decided to start his own business and purchase renovation equipment. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 3,000 GEL for equipment. He will work for himself and will increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to do renovations.

loans.name: Nebi

texts.en:
Nebi is a 32-year-old hardworking man who lives in the rural south-central Albania. He is married and has a very young child. He started in his profession at a very young age as an electrician working with hydraulic machines and this keeps him busy almost all the time. 

Many residents from the nearby villages who had immigrated to Greece are coming back now and building houses or other types of buildings, so he considers himself lucky that his services are in high demand at the moment and will be for quite some time to come. 

Nebi wants to invest this loan in a hydraulic machine as the one he has broke down last month. "Without it, I can’t do much. I will very much appreciate any lender who will help me financially to buy the machine as soon as possible,” Nebi said.

loans.use: to invest in a hydraulic machine for his business.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 33-year-old lady who works at home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for the past seven years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a stock of threads along with packs of zippers and buttons in different colors. Thiswill help her to stitch more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads along with packs of zippers and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 28 years old and is a vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past three years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. 

Asia’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. In order to complete the orders of her customers on time, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in different colors. She shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in different colors.

loans.name: Sona's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois nouvellement  inauguré ce 11 septembre 2013 est composé de  femmes ayant un vœu ardent d’intégrer le programme de bancs villageois. Elles entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel et vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs années. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la culture saisonnière sous pluie.

Madame SONA, âgée de 31 ans (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux garçons et une fille. Elle s’active dans la vente de friperie et des thioub.   
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter trois lot de friperie à 7500f l’unité et quatre thioub à 6000f l’unité.
 Les bénéfices me permettent de renforcer son épargner pour obtenir durant les prochains cycles de prêts plus importants.
texts.en:
This new "banc villageois" was formed on September 11, 2013 and is made up of women with a strong desire to follow the "banc villageois" program. They maintain strong relationships among themselves and help each other; they have all lived in the same village for many years. The women's principal business is operating small businesses and seasonal farming in the rainy season. 

Sona, 31 years old (pictured seated on the far right with her left hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of three children, two boys and one girl. She is in the business of selling used clothing and dyed cotton cloth. With this new loan, she plans to purchase three lots of used clothing at 7500 francs CFA each and four units of dyed cotton cloth at 6000 francs CFA each. The profits will allow her to increase her savings and allow her to qualify for larger loans in future loan cycles.

loans.use: to purchase three lots of used clothing at 7500 francs CFA each and four units of dyed cotton cloth at 6000 francs CFA each.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is a 28-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband who is also shown in the photo. They have been doing it together for the past four years. Her husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market and by dealing with customers. They make enough income to run their household expenses efficiently. Fareeda is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, grains and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, grains and beverages.

loans.name: Pukhraj

texts.en:
Pukhraj is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has six years of experience in this field. Her husband is employed is a private firm but also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the wholesale market. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy packs of salts, oil, rice and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, oil, rice and beverages.

loans.name: Shahbana

texts.en: Shahbana, age 38, is a married woman.  She has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide financial support for her family for many years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy reels of threads in different colors along with the packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment of the embroidery. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hoping to increase her income by targeting more customers. She is in her second loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en: Manana is a 57-year-old woman. She lives in the Zestaponi district. Manana works as a nurse at the local hospital and earns 240 GEL (Georgian Lari)  per month. She decided to start an additional business and begin trading linens and dishes. This will be a new business for her as she has no experience. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and MFO Credo, enables her to get a loan of $650 for stock. She will go to Turkey and purchase linens and dishes from the wholesalers and then sell them in Georgia to buyers in her district. This will increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase linens and dishes to sell

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: María, con 54 años de edad, se dedica a atender su negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició hace aproximadamente 30 años, con la que ha generado los ingresos suficientes para sacar a sus 4 hijos adelante. Manifiesta que le gusta ser independiente, pues al tener su negocio en la casa donde vive, le permite seguir al frente de su hogar. Hace varios años, ella se vio obligada a cerrar su negocio debido a la violencia que se desató en el barrio, pues temía por su vida y la de su familia; durante este tiempo comenzó a trabajar como madre comunitaria con el ICBF y hoy en día alterna ambas actividades, dado que la situación mejoró notablemente en el sector. La cliente, en su afán de seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, solicita el crédito para comprar una nevera y surtido al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, granos, galletería, lácteos, entre otros), de esta forma aumentará su capacidad de almacenamiento, especialmente de lácteos y cárnicos y tendrá más variedad de productos disponibles para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus compradores, afectando positivamente la entrada de dinero a las finanzas familiares. María desea seguir trabajando para hacer crecer su negocio, ampliando su portafolio de productos para que sus clientes encuentren todo lo que requieren y así poder generar mayor rentabilidad, dando la oportunidad de tener una estabilidad económica favorable y una calidad de vida deseada, para disfrutarla al lado de los que ama.
texts.en:
María, 54 years old, runs her own grocery store, a store that she opened about 30 years ago and through which she has been able to generate the income to provide for her 4 children. María says that she enjoys being independent, and the fact that her business is located at her house, also allowed her to take care of her home. 

Several years ago, due to increase of violence in her neighborhood, María was forced to close her business, as she feared for her safety and that of her family. At that point, she began to work as a “Community Mother” with the ICBF (the Colombian Institute of Family Welfare), and ever since the situation improved in her neighborhood and she re-opened her business, María has been carrying out both activities.

Now, in an effort to further improve her business, María is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator and wholesale supplies (snacks, soft drinks, bulk grains, biscuits, dairy products, among others). In this way she will be able to increase her stored merchandise -especially dairy and meat products- and have a larger variety of supplies available to meet her customers’ needs, which would be positive for the family finances. 

María wishes to continue to work to make her business grow, and generate higher returns by increasing the stock of her products, so that her customers may find everything they need. This will help her to achieve economic stability and a pleasant quality of life that she may enjoy with with her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and wholesale supplies (snacks, soft drinks, bulk grains, biscuits, dairy products, among others).

loans.name: Grashana Group

texts.en:
Marivel is the featured borrower of the Grashana group.  She joined with the other group members to request a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to fight for their living by working as housekeepers in Lebanon.

Marivel is a 37-year-old single mother of two children. She is her family's sole breadwinner. Marivel is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to pay for her children's education and medication. Marivel is the second woman from the right in the picture. As for the other group members, Andrea is the first woman in the picture from the left, Ligaya is the second, Yolanda is at the center of the picture with yellow top, and Loberita is the first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education and medication

loans.name: Tilita Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman cuatro socias comerciantes una de ellas es María del Socorro tiene 68 años de edad, soltera, con tres hijos, se dedica al negocio de vender especies y pinolillo desde hace 10 años, Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 5 años. El crédito lo solicita para invertir en el negocio y comprar maíz, cacao, leña, canela, pimienta, clavo de olor, achote. Concepción tiene 44 años su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio, María tiene 48 años, su negocio es la venta de comida  y nacatamales, Rosa tiene 30 años su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en: This group is made up of four businesswomen, one of whom is 68-year-old María del Socorro.  She is single and has three children.  María has had a business selling spices and "pinolillo" (a cornmeal and cacao drink) for ten years.  She has been a member of the communal bank for five years.  María is applying for this loan to invest in her business and buy prime materials for cereals, such as corn, cacao, firewood, cinnamon, pepper, and clove.  Concepción is 44 years old and has a grocery store that she runs out of her home.  María is 48 years old and sells food while Rosa is 30 years old and has a business selling new clothes.

loans.use: to buy prime materials for cereals, such as corn, cacao, firewood, cinnamon, pepper, and clove.

loans.name: Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Créer ce 18 septembre 2013 à l’occasion de son inauguration dans la place publique du village, ce banc villageois compte en son sein des femmes déterminées à entreprendre des activités génératrices de revenu et de renforcer leur capacité de financement. Elles vivent dans un même village depuis plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce. 

Madame Binta, âgée de 56 ans (assise à l’extrême droite avec la gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est veuve et mère deux garçons. Elle est vendeuse de produits alimentaires à savoir le riz, l’huile, le lait, …. Au marché central de la commune pour la revente dans son village et aux environs 

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter deux sacs de riz pour 28 000 F CFA, 01 bidon de 20 litres d’huile raffine à 13 500 F CFA, un carton de lait de sachet de 25 grammes à 8 500 F CFA. Mil pour transformation en farine de mil une dizaines de kilos de sucre et autres ingrédients.

Les bénéfices me permettent d’une part d’aider mon mari à prendre en charge les besoins de la famille et d’autre part à accroître mon chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Within this Banc Villageois, which was set up on 18th September 2013 and inaugurated in the village's public square, there is a group of women who are determined to undertake income-generating activities and strengthen their funding capacity. They have lived in the same village for several decades and have a strong community spirit and a desire to help one another out. They run small trading activities.  

Binta, who is 56 years old (sitting on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is a widow and mother to two boys. She sells groceries such as rice, oil, milk, etc. which she buys in the commune's central market for resale in her village and the surrounding areas.

With her new loan she is planning to buy two sacks of rice for 28,000FCFA, a 20-liter container of refined oil for 13,500FCFA, a carton of 25g milk sachets for 8,500FCFA, millet for making millet flour, around ten kilos of sugar and other ingredients.

The profits will enable her partly to help out her husband with the family's needs and partly to increase her turnover.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice for 28,000FCFA, one 20-liter container of refined oil for 13,500FCFA, a carton of 25g milk sachets for 8,500FCFA, millet for making millet flour,   around ten kilos of sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is from Iraq. He is a 31-year-old client, who is married and has two children. Maher is the sole provider for the family and he works hard to provide them with the profit he gains from his shop. In his shop, Maher specializes in selling cosmetics, creams, soaps and shampoos; he also sells outfits for women and children. He established his business in 2010 and has gained good experience in what he practices and gained the respect of his neighborhood.

Maher is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. Maher believes that through this loan, he will be able to continue providing for his family. His aim is to improve the quality of his business in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Etta

texts.en: Etta, 33, lives in Logan Town with her fiancée and three children between the ages 7 and 14. Her children are in school. She has been selling clothes and slippers in the local market. She says with her business they are able to send their children to school. She says they started this business with money from her fiancée. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and slippers for her business. She plans to expand her business even more and in the future to see her children attending college.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and slippers for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Here is 38-year-old Irene, she lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is married and has four children aged between five and 17, they are presently in school and live at home. She is a 10th grade dropout. 

For the past 14 years she has been running a table where she sells shower slippers for children and adults. She started this business with a little money she saved over a year and learned this way of selling from her friends. She likes her business because she makes lot of profits and it keeps her busy. She is requesting a loan to buy more goods mentioned above for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her business.

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is a youth client from Iraq, who is 27 years old, married and doesn't have a child yet.

Mouhammad owns a small shop where he fixes oven tops. He has a very unique business and has been running it since 2005. Mouhammad has an excellent experience in what he practices and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Mouhammad is requesting a youth loan of 2,200 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his shop and paint it inside and outside. Mouhammad is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he can provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and paint the outside and inside.

loans.name: Hernán Javier

texts.es: Hernán es un hombre de 45 años que durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar como comerciante independiente. Inició con un negocio de comidas rápidas, luego se dedicó a vender mercancía y ahora quiere comenzar con una cafetería, para lo cual ya posee el local y los activos fijos, pero le hace falta el surtido, razón por la cual solicita el crédito, pues desea realizar unas adecuaciones locativas y comprar todo lo necesario como gaseosas, mecato, confitería, galletería, alimentos fritos, café entre otros productos, así podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo, con el que espera generar los ingresos necesarios para sacar adelante a su familia. Hernán se caracteriza por ser un hombre dedicado, activo y trabajador, sabe que para lograr sus objetivos debe luchar incansablemente, con disciplina y esfuerzo. Esto le ayudará para que en un futuro logre cumplir el sueño de tener una cafetería grande, donde pueda generar oportunidades de empleo y a medida que vaya fortaleciendo su negocio, montar otras sucursales. Así tendrá la oportunidad de seguir luchando para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Hernán is a man of 45 years who makes a living working as an independent shop-keeper. He started with a fast food business, then he sold merchandise and now he wants to set up a café. For this he already owns the premises and fixed assets, but he needs supplies.

He asks for a loan because he would like to make some changes to the premises and to buy everything he needs, like soft drinks, snacks, sweets, cookies, fried foods, coffee and other products, so that he may start his work project with which he hopes to generate the income he needs to provide for his family. 

Hernán is characterized as a dedicated, active and hardworking man. He knows that to achieve his objectives, he must fight tirelessly, with discipline and effort. This will help him fulfill his dream for the future, which is to have a big café where he can create employment opportunities and, as his business grows, set up other branches. By this he will have the opportunity to keep striving to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to make some changes to his premises and to buy everything he needs, like soft drinks, snacks, confectionary, cookies, fried foods, coffee and other products.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en:
Leyla is a 44-year-old married mother of 5 children who has worked as tailor for 20 years to help her husband in making their living. She works from her house because she can’t afford to open a separate business. She is a hard worker who puts much effort into develop her family’s socioeconomic situation.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary products and equipment to improve the quality of her productions. She also will use part of the loan to help her son to pay for some home construction materials to continue building his own house. As for the future, she hopes to open a separate shop outside her house for sewing clothes.

loans.use: to buy necessary products and equipment to improve the quality of her productions

loans.name: Famatta

texts.en:
Famatta is 36 years old and live in Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is single and has two children aged 16 and 14, who are presently in school and live at home. She is a college student. 

For the past ten years she has been selling used clothes. She started her business with a little money from her susu (daily local saving account) and learned this ways of selling from her friends. She enjoys how busy her business has keep her. She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothes for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is a farmer. He has two buffalos and uses them to cultivate his 0.6 hectares of land. On his land Tamaz grows walnut trees and kidney beans. The harvested products are sold. His family consists of his wife, two children and brother-in-law. Each adult in the family gets 52 GEL per month from the government for living under poverty. 

As the income is not enough, Tamaz decided to start an additional business. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 2,000 GEL to purchase a cow. His wife will milk the cow every day and will produce cheese to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Ruth is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past four years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy water, soda and other items to sell, and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and take care of herself and buy new clothes. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy water, soda and other items to sell.

loans.name: Kahengye Group

texts.en:
Jackson is a resident of Kabashaki, Kabingo – Kebisoni, Rukungiri District. He is a mature man of 39 and a father of four. He is happily married and he is a member of Kahengye Group. He operates a small retail shop dealing in sales of second-hand bedding. He also trades in goats as an additional source of income. 

He secured a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy more stock of bedding for his business and he will use part of it to buy more goats for trade. He sells the bed sheets to the local residents.

His main challenge is the poverty within the village; residents want to buy goods at very cheap prices which do not cover his operating costs. He is grateful that Ugafode is always willing to lend to them despite their micro-businesses. He is hard-working.

loans.use: To buy bedding to sell.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter is from a small village of Zugdidi district, western Georgia. She is a 54-year-old woman and lives with her son and daughter-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have a pig and sell piglets. In addition, they have land and grow 100 nut trees and 40 mandarin trees. Eter sells the harvested products. 

She decided to open a grocery store. The Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1,500 GEL to purchase stock and open a grocery store. She will not have to hire a salesperson, because she is going to run the store.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is a hardworking businessman from Talic, Oroquieta City. He makes "suman", a native delicacy made of glutinous rice. He is involved in this type of work to provide for his daily needs. At the age of 24 and single, Rey never thought he could start up a little business of snack vending. 

He seeks financial help from PMPC to purchase additional ingredients for his snack business. He wants to increase his income by increasing his inventory. Rey dreams of expanding his suman business some day.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for his snack business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is from Masis town. She is a teacher with many years of experience teaching at a local school. Margarita lives with her husband and daughter Ovsanna, who studies at Yerevan State University. She specializes in the department of Eastern Studies. Margarita and her husband work hard to sustain their family and at the same time cover Ovsanna's university costs.
