Kiva and Afodenic have supported Janny for years so she’ll buy fertilizer and supplies like Triple, Urea, Completa, etc.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Habib's Group

texts.en:
Habib is a member of this group from Iraq.  He is 45 years old, married with seven children.  He has been selling bananas for eight years. 

Habib is a hard worker.  Every day he starts his day at five in the morning and keep working until he sells all of his bananas.  Habib wants to buy more bananas and also fix his old transport motorcycle.

Habib expects that the loan will generate additional income that will enable him to rent a place where he can store and sell his bananas. 

The story of Habib and his business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona's economic development clients.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and fix his old transport motorcycle.

loans.name: Belal

texts.en:
Belal is 28 years old, married man and has three children who live in Taiz, Yemen.  He is cheerful and a hardworking man. 

He works in a company but earns a low salary.  Every day, he gets up with his characteristic optimism and cheerfulness in order to work.  

Due to his limited resources, Belal is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies to make prepared houses. 

With this loan he will be able to offer a greater variety of houses and rentals for his customers.  He will continue to work hard every day so he can become famous for his work.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to make prepared houses.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is managing her own farm of banana to make a living. Her husband is a farmer, and her two adult children are having their own family. She joined GDMPC in 2011 and recently, she borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, in order to improve her farm and gain an abundant harvest from her banana farm. 

She want to expand her farm by cultivating the adjacent vacant lot. She plans to sell her farm produce in bulk for a higher price. In the future, she wants to improve her business for a better living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, to improve her banana farm and gain abundant harvest.

loans.name: Logo

texts.en:
Logo is 40 years old and married with three children.  She has a small garden where she grows cabbages and cucumbers and she sell her produce in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Logo needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, pick, shovel, garden fork, garden hose and rake.  Logo will use the profits to support her family.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy seeds and garden tools.

loans.name: Pulemau

texts.en:
Pulemau is a 36 woman who is married with five children. 

She has had a small fishing business for five years.  Pulemau needs a loan to buy a fishing net, rope, fishing spear, goggles and life jacket. 

Pulemau will use her profits to to help her family financially.  Pulemau joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María Auxiliadora a su mayoría de edad piensa continuar trabajando en lo que sus padres le han enseñado, en la agricultura, tiene una manzana de cultivo de Piña los cuales requieren de mantenimiento y abonarla con Fertilizantes, Urea, Triple 20, Completo. Con esto su cosecha podrá crecer en buen estado sin temor a que se queme o que la plaga pueda apoderarse de ella. Doña María Auxiliadora agradece profundamente el apoyo que se le ha brindado estos últimos años ya que con estos Financiamiento su economía ha mejorado grandemente.
texts.en: María Auxiliadora intends to continue working at what her parents taught her, agriculture, despite her advancing age.  She has a manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] of pineapple that needs care and to be fertilized with Urea, Triple 20 and Completo.  With this, her crop will be able to grow in good condition with no fear of it being scorched or that pests can take it over.   María Auxiliadora is profoundly grateful for the support she’s gotten these last few years because the loans have helped her economy to improve considerably.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and resides at Villalin, Panaon, in Misamis Occidental along with her family. 

To  make a living, she and her husband grow and harvest vegetables for sale.  She sells her produce in the market and her husband is a part time driver. 

She seeks a loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy fertilizer to improve her farm.  She hopes to gain more profit in return for her investment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah (her son is shown in photo) was born in 1970.  She is married and the mother of four children.  One of her sons works as a rescue officer. 

Sabah has been raising bees and selling honey for one year.  She found her project tom be profitable. So, she is planning to expand by buying more beehives in order to raise her productivity and sales.  This will help her support her children. But she doesn’t have enough money to do so. 

For this reason, Sabah applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more beehives.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
This is Genalyn, 28, resident of Batasan, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Ariel, a mason, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide her income for their everyday expenses.

Genalyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also has a piggery for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Genalyn dreams that her business will get bigger, and hopes that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jose Orbelio

texts.es:
José de 40 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres, con quienes comparte las tareas agrícolas. Debido a las difíciles condiciones de vida de su familia en aquella época, no pudo terminar sus estudios de educación media y estudio solo primer año de bachillerato.

Desde hace 20 años trabaja en la agricultura, su padre le enseño a trabajar desde muy pequeño, cuando ya pudo trabajar solo, rento un terreno para trabajar aparte. Es presidente de la directiva de su comunidad, también tiene conocimientos de fontanería. Para llegar al lugar de siembra camina aproximadamente 600 mts. Todos los días le dedica 6 horas a su cultivo.

El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de insumos agrícolas, Fertilizante, herbicidas, pesticidas y pagar mano de obra para preparar el terreno de siembra.

Tiene pensado seguir trabajando en la siembra de frijol, y administrar un invernadero que será donado a la comunidad y hará lo posible por mantener dichas instalaciones.
texts.en:
José, 40, is single and has no children; he lives with his parents who share the agricultural tasks with him.  Due to his family’s life conditions in the past he wasn’t able to complete his secondary education; he only attended one year of high-school.

He’s worked in agriculture for 20 years.  His father taught him to work when he was still very young and when he was able to work alone leased land to work apart.  He’s president of his community’s governing board and also has plumbing skills.  To get to his fields, he must walk about 600 meters.  He spends about 6 hours  daily working his crops.

The loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer, herbicide and pesticides and to pay labor costs to prepare the soil for planting.  He intends to continue working growing beans and managing a nursery that will be donated to his community.  He will do everything possible to maintain said installations.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Yadira Isabel

texts.es: Yadira es una mujer de 44 años de edad que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició de manera empírica. Inicialmente tenía un kiosco ubicado dentro de un colegio del sector donde reside, allí aprendió gran parte de lo que hoy sabe sobre el manejo de este tipo de establecimientos. La cliente es una señora emprendedora, activa y pujante, dedicada a su labor, pues se ha convertido en la columna vertebral de la economía de su familia, conformada por sus dos hijos y su compañero sentimental con quien convive en unión libre. Solicita el crédito con el ánimo de comprar una vitrina para exhibir los productos y surtido al por mayor (galletería, mecato, productos de aseo, café, confitería, entre otros), así tendrá más variedad de artículos disponibles para satisfacer las necesidades de sus compradores, dándole la posibilidad de aumentar sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe por ellas. Yadira sueña con hacer de su negocio una actividad rentable, que le permita tener una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su hijo mayor la oportunidad de tener una educación universitaria y continuar velando por el bienestar de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Yadira, 44 years old, runs her own business, a grocery store that she started as an experiment. At first, she had a kiosk located inside a high school in the neighborhood where she lives. There she learned a great deal of what she knows today about running this kind of establishment. This client, Yadira, is a hard-working, active, and thriving, dedicated to her work. She has become the central core of her family's economy, a family that consists of her two children and her common-law partner.

She is requesting this loan in hopes of buying a glass case to exhibit her goods and her wholesale stock, including cookies, pastries, cleaning supplies, coffee, candy, and more. That way, she will have a greater variety of merchandise available to meet the needs of her buyers, giving her the chance to increase her sales and her income from them.

Yadira dreams of making her business a profitable venture, one that provides her and her family with economic stability and the opportunity to send her oldest son to university and the ability to keep flying high for the well-being of her entire family.

loans.use: Purchase a glass case to showcase her goods and wholesale stock.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 26 year old married woman with four children.  She runs a small business selling pancakes and has been in operation for two years. 

Victoria has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, dripping oil, baking soda and large frying pan. 

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital.  With her earnings, Victoria will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pancake supplies.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a 52 year old married with 11 children.  She runs a sewing shop in her community and has many years of experience. 

Nora has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, more material, thread and oil. 

She plans to use her profits to improve her business and to support her family financially.  She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, material, thread and oil.

loans.name: Sunite

texts.en:
Sunite is a 25-year-old who lives with her partner and four children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taros, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. Sunite has requested a loan to buy chemicals, wheelbarrow, barb wire, backpack sprayer and pickaxe.
 
She recently joined SPBD in 2013. With her profits, Sunite hopes to help improve her family standard of living and their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, wheelbarrow, barb wire, backpack sprayer and a pickaxe.

loans.name: Muterian

texts.en:
Muterian is 48 years old and married.  He supports a family of five children.  He is a wheat farmer and he rears livestock.   Muterian has been in business for 23 years.  He earns a monthly income of KES 12000. 

He is seeking his sixth loan of KES 100000 from KADET to help prepare his farm and purchase needed inputs. Some of the funds will be used to cater to his livestock.

Muterian hopes to use his anticipated profits to expand his farm and to reinvest.  His future dreams are to improve his family's standard of living and to educate his children

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and livestock supplies.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña María del Carmen es una mujer de 38 años de edad, casada la cual goza de una excelente salud con mucha energía y mucho entusiasmo al momento de ejercer su trabajo. Ella trabaja en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos de los cuales el mayor está casado en hogar a parte y colabora con algunas de las actividades del campo y el menor el cual vive con ellos y al igual que el mayor ayuda a sus padres diariamente con las actividades en la plantación de café, como: aplicación de abono, foliares, formula cafetalera, limpieza, etc. Los 3 viven en la misma casa y doña María del Carmen tiene más de 15 años de dedicarse a esta actividad en compañía de su esposo. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a 4 kilómetros de distancia al cual se traslada a pie o en vestía. Sus sueños como madre de familia es poder educar a su hijo para que él pueda vivir en mejores condiciones, tengan más oportunidades en la vida.

Doña María del Carmen solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para  la compra de 4 QQ de urea, 18 sacos de abono 18-46-0, 5 litros de foliares, 6 litros de boro, entre otros para poder asistir sus cultivos de café y obtener una mejor producción y una mejor ganancia de la venta misma.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is 38 years old and married. She enjoys excellent health, plenty of energy, and a great deal of enthusiasm for her work. She works alongside her husband and their two children. The older son is married and lives in a separate home, but works with them on various activities in the field. The younger lives at home, and like the older, he helps his parents daily with the work on the coffee plantation, including the application of fertilizers, herbicide, and plant food formulated specifically for coffee, as well as cleaning.  María del Carmen has more than fifteen years of experience focusing in this activity alongside her husband. Their coffee fields are located four kilometers from their home, a distance which they walk. Her dream as a mother is to be able to educate her son so that he can live in better conditions and have more opportunities in life.

María is requesting this financing through the COMIXMUL cooperative to purchase 4 quintales of urea (approximately 100 lbs each), 18 sacks of fertilizer, 5 liters of herbicide, 6 liters of boron, and other supplies needed to aid her coffee growing and obtain a better production and subsequently higher earnings.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies for growing coffee

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia is a 50 year old married woman with eight children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taros, bananas and yams to earn a living.  Malia has been doing this work for more than six years. 

Malia has requested a loan to buy a wide variety of garden tools and supplies.  

Malia recently joined SPBD in 2013.  With her profits, she hopes to improve her family's standard of living and meet their everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of garden tools and supplies.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 40 years old married to Richard.  Together they support a family of five.  

Phoebe runs a cereals and grocery business in Kericho town.  This has been her income generating business for the last two years; she earns an average monthly income of Kshs 40,000. 

She seeks a second loan with Kadet Ltd of Kshs 60,000.  With this loan she plans to purchase more cereal for resale, to boost her business. 

Phoebe's dream is to expand her business into a big cereal store and to expand her grocery business.

loans.use: to purchase more cereal.

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en:
Annelyn, 25, is a creative woman. She is married with two children, ages two and five. 

She sells prepaid loaded phones to her customers in the community of San Miguel, where she lives with her family. 

Annelyn is asking for a loan to buy more prepaid loads in order to generate a bigger income. She is hoping that someday she will be able to have another business to better support her family, specially her children.

Income generated from her business is used for nutritious food for her children.

loans.use: to buy more prepaid loads

loans.name: Group 10 At Lien Mac 1

texts.en: Oanh, pictured first on the right, is 51 years old this year.  She works as a farmer with a monthly salary of about VND 700,000.  She is married with one child, who is now an adult.  Her family does not yet have a sanitary toilet at home.  However, she recently joined a campaign through her local Women's Union, where she has been a member since 1983, to improve the community's sanitation and hygiene.  With this loan, Oanh will build a sanitary toilet that will improve her family and community's quality of life and help them stay healthy by avoiding the diseases and infections commonly associated with using an unsafe latrine.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet

loans.name: Group 11 At Lien Mac 1

texts.en: Luyen, pictured first on the right, is 52 years old and married with two grown children.  As a farmer, she makes about VND 800,000 a month.  She has been a member of her local Women's Union since 1980 and recently joined a campaign to improve her community's sanitation and hygiene.  Currently, her family does not have a hygienic toilet.  With this loan, Luyen will install a toilet that will improve the quality of life for all of her family members and help her family and community avoid the diseases and infections commonly associated with unsanitary latrines.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. He has three children and has been doing this work for twenty years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Selling milk!" His biggest challenge is ''feeding animals in drought season." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Kitanga and Nyameni; both are cows."

Godfrey was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "They have brought their services to us."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "One can develop from the microloans."  His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how will this loan benefit his family, Godfrey replied "Will see my children through college."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Godfrey owns the following: "cow, poultry, bicycle" but does not own "pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower does not have "mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is 34 years old divorced, with two children ages 13 and three years.

She has a pool table business in Naivasha which she has been running for two years.   Evalyn has applied for her first loan from Kadet ltd. to enable her repair her pool table.  Evalyn plans to pay school fees with her anticipated profit. 

In the near future, Evalyn hopes to see her children well educated.

loans.use: to repair a pool table.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 23 years old and supports his one sibling and his aging parents.  He has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for three years and he earning kes 16,000 per month. He learned about Kadet from other riders in Narok town who have already been funded by Kadet ltd.

Antony has been advanced a first loan of kes 91,019 which will enable him to purchase his own motorcycle. This is likely to help him earn more income as he already has an established customer base. 

He will use the proceeds to repay the loan and cater to the needs of his family.  Antony's dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Taaloga

texts.en:
Taaloga is a 36-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years. Taaloga has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a weed sprayer, barbed wire, a shovel and boots. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Taaloga hopes to help improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a weed sprayer, barbed wire, a shovel and boots

loans.name: Jairo Enrique

texts.es: Jairo se ha dedicado durante 20 años a trabajar en su negocio, una tienda y legumbrería, actividad que conoció gracias a su familia, ya que es una tradición pues todos se han dedicado a ser comerciantes independientes. Trabaja todos los días de 6:00 am a 10:00 pm, en compañía de su esposa y uno de sus hijos, de esta forma ha generado los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos y necesidades familiares. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, lácteos, granos, panela, pastas, entre otros) de esta manera incrementará su inventario y tendrá mayor variedad de productos disponible para satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de sus compradores, lo que dará como resultado un incremento en los ingresos que percibe para su familia. Jairo desea fortalecer y acreditar aún más sus negocio, para que le genere una estabilidad económica que le permita dejar la tienda como legado para que sus hijos puedan continuar con el negocio y lo conviertan en una supermercado, rentable y reconocido y así, se forjen un futuro de progreso y éxito.
texts.en:
Jairo has been running his grocery and vegetables store for 20 years. He was introduced to this activity by his family, it is a tradition among them since everybody in his family have worked as independent merchants. He works every day from 6 am to 10 pm together with his wife and one of their children. That way he has generated the necessary incomes to pay for the expenses and needs of his family. 

He is applying for a loan in order to buy wholesale supplies such as snacks, soft drinks, dairy products, grains, unrefined whole cane sugar, noodles, etc. This way he will be able to increase his inventory and have a greater variety of products available so that he can satisfy the needs and tastes of his buyers. This will give him economic stability and allow him to pass the store on to his children so that they can continue the business and turn it into a profitable and acknowledged supermarket, which will bring them a future of progress and success.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies such as snacks, soft drinks, dairy products, grains, unrefined whole cane sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Aqil

texts.en:
Aqil is a 22 year old farmer who is single.  He grows and sells fruits and vegetables.  He was not fortunate to finish school or go to university and had to work on his farm to support his family. 

Aqil has a brother who's name is Haider.  He is in his last year of high school.  Since his work is seasonal he always worries about not making enough money and saving some money to help cover his brother’s school expenses. 

Every year Aqil face the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the school year, for the additional expenses that occur to cover school fees, uniform and  books.  With this loan he can cover all these expenses.

Aquil is requesting a loan to pay his brother's tuition fees and other school expenses.  Haider plan to continue his university education after finishing high school.

The story of Haider is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona's economic development clients who was able to obtain a better education.

loans.use: to pay his brother's tuition fees and other school expenses.

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en:
Hoda is a married mother of three children who has worked as a butcher for twenty years. They serve high quality meat at special prices. Hoda’s long experience in this field provided her with customers' trust and support even though it is weird in her region for a woman to work as a butcher, which is always given the image of a man’s business. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business income through buying cows and increasing their meat capital to better respond to the increasing customers’ requests.

As for the future, Hoda is willing to increase the number of cows she owns to open her own farm and to expand her business and increase productivity.

loans.use: to increase her business income through buying cows and increasing their meat capital to better respond to the increasing customers’ requests

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fish net, gasoline and floaters

loans.name: Eseneiaso

texts.en:
Eseneiaso is a 35-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Eseneiaso needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, boxes of chicken, soy sauce, garlic, onions, a container and a pot. She plans to use her profits to assist her family financially. 

Eseneiaso became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, boxes of chicken, soy sauce, garlic, onions, a container and a pot.

loans.name: Siempre Unidas De Smp Group

texts.es: Elsa es miembro de la alcancía “SIEMPRE UNIDAS DE SMP” este grupo lo integran 8 socias todas son amigas y vecinas del mismo barrio. Elsa es divorciada tiene 03 hijos la ultima de 10 años es la más pequeña y depende de ella, desde hace 5 años  se dedica a la venta de menestras tiene un puesto alquilado en un mercado de su zona, su negocio esta prosperando gracias a sus clientas que siempre acuden  a comprarle los productos que vende, trabaja 8 horas diarias por la mañana en las tardes se dedica a sus hijos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de menestras al por mayor esto le permitirá tener mejores ganancias y seguir creciendo como comerciante. Elsa esta agradecida  a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo de su grupo, en la foto es la cuarta de la izquierda(paradas) viste chompa blanca.
texts.en: Elsa is a member of the group "Siempre Unidas de SMP" this group is formed by 8 members that are friends and neighbors of the same district.  Elsa is divorced, has a 3 children, the youngest one is 10 years old and depends on her, for 5 years she has been selling "menestras" (vegetable stew) in a stand that she rents at a market of her area, her business is successful thanks to her customers that always come to buy the products that she sells, she works 8 hours a day in the morning and in the evening she is with her children.  The loan will be invested in buying "menestras" at wholesale, this will allow her to make better profits and be able to continue growing as a merchant.  Elsa is thankful to the KIVA investors for the loan to her group, in the picture she is the 4th from the left (standing) she is wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE”  es un grupo que está conformado por 09 socios quienes se dedican a diversas actividades del comercio minorista. Aniceta tiene 64 años y es casada con hijos independientes. Aniceta a sus 64 años se dedica a la venta de queso y yogurt natural hace 1 años a la vez se dedica al tejido  a base de lana elaborando  chompa chalinas y guantes. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de más queso y yogurt natural. su meta a futuro es en implementar una pequeña bodega  al cual se pueda dedicar con mayor tranquilidad.  El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado.  Aniceta es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste casaca gris.
texts.en:
The “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE” communal bank is composed of 9 members who have various retail businesses. Aniceta is 64 years old, married and has grown children. For the past year she has been selling cheese and natural yogurt. At the same time she knits wool based products like sweaters, scarfs and gloves.

Aniceta will use this loan to buy more cheese and natural yogurt. Her future goal is to open a small store where she can work more peacefully. The group thanks the lenders at Kiva for the loan offered. Aniceta is the second from the left wearing a grey jacket.

loans.use: to buy more cheese and natural yogurt.

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es: Gloria es una joven madre, que busca la manera de cómo salir adelante junto a sus 3 hijos que son unos adolecentes, todos van a la escuela y para Gloria ellos son su prioridad, su mayor deseo es verlos a todos con una carrera profesional. Su actividad comercial es la venta de ropa, calzado, accesorios para celulares, los cuales vende en su casa de habitación. Con este crédito desea invertir en el negocio, para apoyarse y seguir manteniendo los estudios de sus hijos y la alimentación.
texts.en:
Gloria is a young mother who was looking for a way for her and her three children to get ahead. Her children are already adolescent, they all go to school, and they are Gloria's number one priority. Her greatest desire is to see all of them in a professional career.

Her business is selling clothing, footwear, and cell phone accessories, which she sells out of her home. With this loan, she will invest in her business to support herself and continue to feed her children and send them to school.

loans.use: purchase clothing, footware, and cell phone accessories

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal was born in 1962. She is married, and the mother of two who are married. Her husband is a retired man. 

Nawal has been selling blankets for a year. She is planning to add selling clothes to her project in order to raise her sales; this will let her earn more income that will let her be a good support for her husband to improve their living conditions. 

Now she needs to buy clothes, but doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ricardo Roque

texts.es:
Ricardo de 67 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 11 y solo tres viven con  él, el  de 15 años, 18 años y 20 años de edad, lo dos menores estudian y el mayor le ayuda con los trabajos agrícolas. Solo pudo estudiar hasta cuarto grado por las dificultades económicas que su familia tenía en aquel tiempo. Su señora se dedica a criar gallinas criollas para la venta, también con el vive un nieto de 12 años.

Desde pequeño Ricardo trabaja en labores agrícolas, le enseño su padre de quien todo aprendió. Se levanta a las 6 de la mañana para ir a trabajar en su parcela y regresa a las 11 de la mañana. Al casarse con la que ahora es su esposa aprendió el oficio de albañilería, pero al ser poco demandado se dedico a la siembra de granos básicos.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar 3 terneros para engordarlos y luego venderlos a buen precio. 
Tiene como propósito que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y que aprendan mas de algún oficio para que puedan valerse por si mismos.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 67, is married. He has 11 children and 3 live with him. They are 15, 18, and 20 years old. The two younger ones go to school and the older one helps with farming work. Ricardo was only able to go to school through fourth grade due to his family's financial difficulties at the time. His wife makes a living raising creole chickens to sell. Also living with them is a 12 year old grandson.

Since he was young, Ricardo has worked as a farmer. His father taught him everything he knows. He gets up at six in the morning to go work on his land and he returns at eleven in the morning. After marrying his wife, he learned construction skills, but because there was little demand, he made a living by planting basic grains.

This loan will be used to buy three calves to raise and then sell at a good price. One of his goals is for his children to finish school and learn more than just a trade so they will value themselves.

loans.use: to buy three calves and raise them.

loans.name: Una Luz Al Desarrollo Group

texts.es: El grupo “UNA LUZ AL DESARROLLO” es uno de los grupos puntuales en sus cuotas. El grupo está conformado por 06 socias quienes se sienten muy contentas por encontrarse pasando el 27 ciclo. Flora tiene 50 años es casada con un educando en la universidad en grupo cumple la función de presidenta quien hace 7 se dedica a la crianza de pollos para luego expenderlo a las pollerías  y a la vez se dedica a dar en  alquiler  mototaxis. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos para sus aves. Su mayor de deseo es  incrementar la crianza de pollo. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Flora es la que se encuentra en medio de las 04 personas y de la misma manera se encuentra incluida la foto de Mirma en la parte superior izquierda.  Que no puedo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en:
The “UNA LUZ AL DESARROLLO” communal bank is a group who pays their installments punctually. This group is composed of 6 members who feel very content going into their 27 loan cycle. 

Flora is 50 years old and married. She has a university degree and is the president of the group. For the past 7 years she has been raising chickens and then selling them to poultry shops. At the same time she also rents out motorcycle taxis. Flora will use the loan to buy feed for her chickens. Her greatest desire is to raise more chickens.

The group thanks the lenders at Kiva for the loan. Flora is in the middle of the other four people. Mirna, whose photo appears in the upper corner, could not be at the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Harry

texts.en:
Harry is a single man of 27. He operates a M-PESA shop (mobile phone-based money transfer business) by sending and withdrawing money to customers in Eldama Ravine.

He has been in business for 7 months, and his monthly income is 20,000 Kenyan shillings. He has borrowed money from Kadet to increase his float level; with the anticipated profits, he will enlarge his business in the area.

This is his first loan from Kadet.

loans.use: Will use the loan to increase his float with his money transfer business.

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en:
At 51 years old, Josiah is married to Lydia who is a laboratory technician and he is the father of four children aged 20, 18, 9 and 2 years old.

He is from Olkalou and runs a chain of Mpesa shops which provide mobile money transfer services in his hometown and which have been in operation for the last five years. Josiah has applied for his first loan of KES 100,000 from Kadet Ltd which will enable him to increase the float for his business, with the remaining sum to be used in purchasing mobile phones to sell to his customers.

From his business he realizes a monthly income of KES 30,000 and his plan is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children and pay his loan to Kadet Ltd.

His hopes and dreams for his future business are to open Mpesa shops even in other towns and for his family to be self reliant and happy.

loans.use: To add on to his Mpesa float and to buy phones to sell to his customers

loans.name: Etelgibe Aleyda

texts.es: La señora Etelgibe madre soltera de 4 hijos en edades escolares, para ella la prioridad en su vida son sus hijos. la actividad comercial de Etelgibe es venta de Ropa tiene mas de 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio en su casa de habitacion tiene un pequeño puesto donde los clientes llegan a ver Mercaderia y tambien trabaja con ventas ambulantes. el credito lo solicita para invertir en el negocio y comprar mas mercaderia y acondicionar un poco el lugar para que sea un pequeña tiendita. agradece a Kiva y Afodenic por la confianza brindada.
texts.en:
Etelgibe is a single mother of four school-aged children. They are her number one priority in life. Her business consists of selling clothing, a business which she has run for more than five years. She has a small space in her home where her customers come to see her merchandise, and she also works in traveling sales as well. 

The loan she is requesting will be invested in her business through the purchase of additional merchandise, and will also be used to improve her space a bit to turn it into a small store. She thanks Kiva and Afodenic for their confidence in her.

loans.use: purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is a married young lady who studies at the Yerevan State Institute of Theater and Cinema. Along with her studies, Lusine works at a local art school where she is a teacher of little children. Lusine is a very enthusiastic and kind lady with a prosperous future. 

She lives together with her parents-in-law and husband. The whole family works hard to sustain their living, and cover daily costs. It is very difficult for Lusine to save money for education, so she has applied to us for a loan. She asks a loan to pay her tuition fee, and to be able to continue her education at the university.

Lusine hopes for lenders' support, and will be very grateful for their goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda has a variety store, and she used her loan in buying different grocery items and toiletries. She also has a piggery and some videoke machines for rental. She sells gas for additional income. Her loan has helped in the education of her two children. His husband is helping her in managing their household and in providing for their family.

She would like to apply for another PHP 60,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory.  The more items displayed at the store, the better.  More items to sell will result in more profits.  Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Yolanda hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 50 years old and from Olkalou. He is married to Agnes, who is a farmer, and they have four children aged 27, 24, 21 and 17 years old.

He is a farmer who specializes in mixed farming, an occupation he has been carrying out for the last six years. Julius has applied for his seventh loan from KADET Ltd. for Kshs. (Kenyan shillings) 70,000. The loan will enable him to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and planting seeds, and the rest will be used in paying school fees for his children.

His monthly income from his expanded business at present is Kshs. 30,000. His plan is to use the profits from his expanded business in supporting his family and repaying his loan to KADET Ltd.

He hopes to open a timber yard in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like planting seeds and fertilizer, and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Consuelo De Jesús

texts.es: Consuelo tiene 65 años de edad, 20 de ellos se ha dedicado a laborar en el oficio de la confección, trabajando en diferentes empresas y talleres, pero, con el ánimo de generar ingresos por cuenta propia, decidió independizarse y, hace 6 años abrió su propio taller de costura y confección ubicado en la casa donde vive con su familia, de esta manera ha generado los ingresos suficientes para solventar la carga económica que recayó sobre ella luego del fallecimiento de su esposo hace poco tiempo. A pesar de las adversidades y de la situación de tristeza y dolor que ha vivido, ella supo llevar la situación y poco a poco ha superado esta difícil prueba. El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de materia prima al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, entre otros), de esta forma podrá tener materias disponible para sacar su producción a tiempo, con lo que podrá aumentar su clientela, esto dará resultado el incremento de sus ingresos. Consuelo desea seguir trabajando fuertemente para fortalecer aún más su negocio y ampliarlo para tener la posibilidad de generar empleo entre sus familiares, además mejorará su calidad de vida y la de todo su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 65 years old and has spent 20 of those years focused on the business of dressmaking, working in various businesses and shops. With the urge to earn income for herself, she decided to go independent, and six years ago, she opened her own sewing and dressmaking shop, located in her family's home. By doing this, she has been able to earn enough income to meet the financial burden that fell on her with the recent death of her husband. In spite of these difficulties, and the pain and sadness she has lived through, she has risen to the occasion, and is getting through this difficult test a little at a time. 

The loan she is requesting will be invested in her business through the purchase of raw materials at wholesale, including fabrics, thread, buttons, and more. By doing this, she will have the materials she needs at her disposal so that she can finish her work on time. This will help her expand her customer base and increase her income. Consuelo wants to keep working hard to strengthen her business even more, eventually expanding it to be able to employ family members. That way, she can improve not only her own quality of life, but that of her entire family.

loans.use: purchase fabric, thread, and more at wholesale.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 45 years old and from Trinidad, Bohol.

She is married with nine children between the ages of 1 and 18. Her husband work as an electrician, and drives their motorcycle for an income, too. 

Corazon owns a sari-sari store that caters to the needs of her neighborhood. She sells basic household items like seasoning, canned goods, noodles, eggs, toiletries, snack food, and soft drinks. 

She is asking for a loan to buy an additional stock of canned sardines, cooking oil, and soft drinks.  With this loan, she is hoping she will have the items needed by her customers. 

Her income will be for the family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned sardines, cooking oil, and soft drinks

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is 24 years old. He lives at a sector in Jordan called Mafraq, with his family which consists of seven siblings and his parents. 

Abdullah is studying for his Bachelor of History; he is in his second year. He is planning to get his bachelor degree so he can work in his field of study  after graduation, to start helping his parents financially. 

But his parents are currently facing a financial crisis, so they cannot help pay his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Oscar Agusto

texts.es: El señor Oscar a sus 44 años de edad se ha dedicado toda la vida a cultivar la tierra gracias a las enseñanzas que sus padres le han dado. casado padre de un hijo en edad de estudios universitarios, su esposa se dedica a las tareas del hogar, el credito lo solicita para restablecer una manzana de cafe ya que esta en proceso de limpia de terreno y requiere fertilizantes e insumos los cuales comprar con el apoyo que KIVA Y AFODENIC le estan brindado con un nuevo financiamiento.
texts.en:
Oscar, 44 years old, has spent his entire life working the land thanks to the lessons he learned from his parents. He is a married father of one son who is a university student. His wife is a homemaker. 

This loan will be used to reestablish a plot of coffee that he is currently in the proceess of cleaning. It requires fertilizers and other supplies which he will buy thanks to the support of a new loan from Kiva and Afodenic.

loans.use: reestablish his coffee field

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a 25-year-old woman married to Wempy, 28, who is an entrepreneur. They only have one child, Chika, who is 6, and an elementary student. Saraswati has been helping her parents run a kiosk business, which was established in 1997 using their own capital.

Saraswati wants to start her own business of tire-patching, as well as selling cell phone credits.  Her determination to make this happen has led her to apply a loan from TLM of IDR 4,500,000. 

The loan will be spent on a tire-patching machine, as well as on cell phone credits to sell.

She hopes that her business will run well so she will be able to repay the loan to TLM right on time.

loans.use: to buy a tire patching machine, as well as cell phone credits to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
36-year-old Corazon is a resident of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married and has two children ages 17 and 20. 

Corazon operates a sari-sari store where she has been selling basic household goods like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasoning, toiletries, and rice for 20 years now. In addition to this, she is also engaged in fishing. 

She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, chips, and fishing nets. 

Corazon hopes that with additional capital, she can continue to improve her profit.

loans.use: to  buy soft drinks, chips, and fishing nets

loans.name: Safeya

texts.en:
Safeya was born in 1969. She is a mother of two. One of her daughters works in the field of statistics. As her husband passed away, she lives with her parents in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. 

Safeya is trying her best to support herself, and to cover her children's needs after her husband's death. She has been working at her mini-market for three years, selling foodstuffs. She started her project with buying small merchandise. 

Now she is planning to add selling clothes to her project to raise her profit. To do so, she needs to buy clothes, which she doesn't have enough money for. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and clothes to sell

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en: Dionesia is 59 years old and from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and has three dependents ages 13, 18 and 19. Together with her husband Dionesia farms rice for an income. This has been their business for 32 years. Dionesia works hard in order to provide for her children, but sometimes she struggles to make it. She is asking for a loan to buy pesticides, fertilizer and pay for labor. She dreams of making the most out of her business so she can give her children a better future through education. The loan will provide hope in her planned business expansion and sustainability.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Senia

texts.en:
Senia is a 59-year-old married woman. She has six children. 

She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as canned food and baked goods. She has been in this business for over five years. Senia needs a loan to buy items for her store, including flour, onions, biscuits, noodles, milk, toilet paper, cigarettes, soft drinks, Vailima beer, sugar, mosquito coils, soap, laundry powder, and salt. She hopes to use the profits to improve her home and expand her shop. 

She became a SPBD member in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store
